mayflower

Class Timer

  • java.lang.Object
    • mayflower.Timer

  • public class Timer
extends java.lang.Object
    A Timer object that can be used to trigger events based on time rather than frame rate.

    A Timer object should be kept as an instance variable and the isDone method should be checked in the act method.

    Example: 
     
 
 public class TestTimer extends Actor
 {
   private Timer t;
   
   public TestTimer()
   {
     t = new Timer(1000); //initialize a timer to trigger every second
   }
   
   public void act()
   {
     if( t.isDone() ) //check if the timer is done
     {
       t.reset(); //restart the timer
       
       //do something that should happen every 1000 milliseconds
     }
   } 
 }

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Timer()
      Initialize and start a Timer with a goal of 0 milliseconds.
      Timer(int goal)
      Initialize and start a Timer with a specified goal time.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void adjust(int diff)
      Adjust the goal time of this timer by the specified amount (in milliseconds) This method will NOT reset the timer.

      Get the number of milliseconds that remain until the timer is done.

      Check if the timer's goal has been met.

      Check if there is at least the specified number of milliseconds left until the timer is done.

      Reset the timer.

      Change the goal time for this timer (in milliseconds) This method will reset the timer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Timer

        public Timer()
        Initialize and start a Timer with a goal of 0 milliseconds. This timer will always return true when isDone is called.

      • Timer

        public Timer(int goal)
        Initialize and start a Timer with a specified goal time. (in milliseconds) The isDone method will return false until goal milliseconds have passed.
        Parameters:
        goal - how many milliseconds must pass before isDone will return true

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(int goal)
        Change the goal time for this timer (in milliseconds) This method will reset the timer.
        Parameters:
        goal - the new goal time

      • adjust

        public void adjust(int diff)
        Adjust the goal time of this timer by the specified amount (in milliseconds) This method will NOT reset the timer.
        Parameters:
        diff - the number of milliseconds to adjust the timer by.

      • isDone

        public boolean isDone()
        Check if the timer's goal has been met.
        Returns:
        true if goal milliseconds have passed since the timer was started.

      • getTimeLeft

        public long getTimeLeft()
        Get the number of milliseconds that remain until the timer is done.
        Returns:
        the number of milliseconds that remain until the timer is done.

      • isTimeLeft

        public boolean isTimeLeft(int time)
        Check if there is at least the specified number of milliseconds left until the timer is done.
        Parameters:
        time - how many milliseconds need to be remaining for this method to return true
        Returns:
        whether the specified number of milliseconds (or more) remain before the timer is done

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Reset the timer. It will start counting from 0 again.
